channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Heatwave: Wales' temperatures could peak as holiday getaway begins
item.description: An extreme heat weather warning is in place as temperatures could hit 32C (90F) on Wednesday.

item.title: Man arrested on murder charge after Cardigan death
item.description: A 37-year-old man died in the town, leading to the arrest of a 22-year-old on Wednesday.

item.title: Dinosaurs: 'Spectacular' fossil footprint find by four-year-old goes on display
item.description: A 200-million-year-old fossilised footprint could help scientists understand how dinosaurs walked.

item.title: Covid antibodies estimated for 92.6% of adults in Wales
item.description: Nearly three quarters of under 25s - and nearly 93% of adults overall - are believed to have antibodies.

item.title: Man, 25, arrested on suspicion of attempted murder in Cardiff's Bute Park
item.description: An 18-year old woman has also been arrested on suspicion of robbery and wounding with intent.

item.title: Daniel Morgan case: Met accused of 'betrayal' over unsolved 1987 murder
item.description: Baroness O'Loan says "incompetence and corrupt acts" hampered investigations into Mr Morgan's death.

item.title: M4: Lanes on motorway at Swansea shut following crash
item.description: Congestion around Swansea as the motorway is partially shut due to emergency repair work.

item.title: Mayhill: ‘Rioters taught my son anger and hatred’
item.description: Adam Romain says his previously loving and calm son has become aggressive after witnessing a riot.

item.title: Alun Wyn Jones to captain British and Irish Lions in first Test against South Africa
item.description: Alun Wyn Jones returns to captain the British and Irish Lions against South Africa on Saturday, in a side including three Scottish players for the first time since 1997.

item.title: Domestic abuse: 'I went to prison three times - I'm so ashamed'
item.description: Mike went to prison three times for domestic violence, but says he has turned his life around.

item.title: Dominic Cummings is delusional, Welsh secretary says
item.description: Simon Hart says it would have been absurd for Dominic Cummings to campaign to remove prime minister.

item.title: Heatwave: Stay safe in the sun, says Welsh Ambulance Service
item.description: The ambulance service urges people to take care as it faces a rising number of 999 calls.

item.title: Heatwave: Hot weather closes Pontyclun pub
item.description: Landlord Simon Cole temporarily shuts the Pipeworks Bar after the mercury hit 30.9C.

item.title: Barry cricket death: 'My friend was literally just dying there'
item.description: Tributes to 44-year-old father-of-three who died playing for his local cricket club.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Duke of Cambridge meets Team GB boxer and medal hopeful Lauren Price
item.description: The Duke of Cambridge meets Team GB boxer and medal hopeful Lauren Price at Kensington Palace.

item.title: Rescuers find lost dog Ollie after swim off Porthcawl
item.description: Ollie was found by the RNLI three miles away from where he jumped into the sea for a swim.

item.title: Covid: Pontypool shoppers want to 'revive' town centre
item.description: Once a major city centre, Pontypool town like many other places has seen shops close due to Covid.

item.title: Steve Cooper: Head coach to leave Swansea City
item.description: Steve Cooper is set to leave his position as Swansea City's head coach.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Team GB footballers begin with win over Chile
item.description: Team GB started their Olympic campaign successfully as the women's football side comfortably beat Chile in an empty stadium in Sapporo, Japan.

item.title: Heineken Champions Cup: Harlequins and Exeter drawn in tier one
item.description: Premiership champions Harlequins will face Castres and Cardiff Blues in the pool stage of next season's Heineken Champions Cup.

item.title: The Hundred: Glamorgan's Dan Douthwaite gets Manchester call
item.description: Glamorgan all-rounder Dan Douthwaite gets a late call to join Manchester Originals in the Hundred.

item.title: British and Irish Lions 2021: Martin Johnson on captaincy in 1997 and 2001
item.description: In 2001 Martin Johnson made history when he became the first man to captain the British and Irish Lions twice, but he almost turned the honour down.

item.title: Arestio dau yn dilyn ymosodiad ym Mharc Bute
item.description: Mae dyn wedi ei arestio ar amheuaeth o geisio llofruddio yn dilyn digwyddiad yn y parc fore Mawrth.

item.title: Rheolau ail dai yn 'annheg' ac 'afresymol' i berchnogion
item.description: Yn ôl rhai perchnogion ail gartrefi, mae'r pwnc yn "llawer mwy cymhleth" nag y mae'n ymddangos.

item.title: Arestio un wedi marwolaeth dyn yng Ngheredigion
item.description: Dywedodd Heddlu Dyfed-Powys bod dyn 37 oed wedi marw yn dilyn digwyddiad yn oriau man 21 Gorffennaf.

item.title: Cam-drin arlein: 'Targed oherwydd mod i'n ddynes'
item.description: Llinos Medi Huws a Bethan Sayed sy'n rhannu profiadau o dderbyn bygythiadau ar-lein

item.title: Alun Wyn Jones yn ôl i'r Llewod tair wythnos wedi anaf
item.description: Bydd yn gapten y Llewod ar gyfer y gêm brawf gyntaf, er iddo ddatgymalu ei ysgwydd fis diwethaf.
